title: 105_s243
content: The Act may be cited as the "Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act" and involves the temporary reinstatement of airport and airway trust fund taxes. The Fuel Tax rates specified in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are amended to 4.3 cents per gallon for aviation gasoline after specific dates. The Fuel Tax rates in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are amended to 4.3 cents per gallon for aviation gasoline after specific dates. The changes include adjustments after December 31, 1996, and after September 29, 1997. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to adjust Fuel Tax rates for aviation gasoline after specific dates, including changes after December 31, 1996, and after September 29, 1997. Ticket taxes for transportation are also amended accordingly. The Airport and Airway Trust Fund Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act adjusts ticket taxes and transfers funds to the Airport and Airway Trust Fund until September 30, 1997. The Airport and Airway Trust Fund financing rate will be zero for taxes imposed after September 29, 1997. Floor Stocks Taxes on Aviation Fuel will be imposed before the tax-increase date described in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act imposes a floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon on aviation fuel held before the tax-increase date. The liability for the tax falls on the person holding the fuel, and payment is to be made as prescribed by the Secretary. The Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act imposes a floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon on aviation fuel held before the tax-increase date. The person holding the fuel is liable for the tax, which must be paid as prescribed by the Secretary on or before the first day of the 7th month after the tax-increase date. The Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act imposes a floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon on aviation fuel held before the tax-increase date. Definitions for terms like "the Code," "tax-increase date," "aviation fuel," "held by a person," and "Secretary" are provided in the Act. The Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act imposes a floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon on aviation fuel held before the tax-increase date. Aviation fuel is considered held by a person if title has passed to them. The Secretary refers to the Secretary of the Treasury. There are exceptions for certain uses and amounts of fuel regarding the tax imposed. The Taxes Short Term Reinstatement Act imposes a floor stocks tax of 17.5 cents per gallon on aviation fuel held before the tax-increase date. No tax is imposed on aviation fuel held on the tax-increase date if the amount does not exceed 2,000 gallons, with required information submitted to the Secretary. The Secretary requires specific information from individuals for tax purposes. Fuel exempt from tax is not considered for this requirement. Controlled groups are treated as one group for tax purposes. For tax purposes, all persons in a controlled group are treated as one group. The term "controlled group" is defined as per section 1563 of the Code, with "more than 50 percent" replacing "at least 80 percent" in the definition. Regulations apply to nonincorporated persons under common control. For tax purposes, the term "controlled group" is defined as per section 1563 of the Code, with "more than 50 percent" replacing "at least 80 percent" in the definition. Regulations also apply to nonincorporated persons under common control. All provisions of law applicable to taxes imposed by section 4091 of the Code apply, insofar as applicable and not inconsistent with this subsection. The amendments made by this section take effect 7 days after the date of enactment of this Act. The taxes imposed by sections 4261 and 4271 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 do not apply to amounts paid for taxable transportation. The taxes on transportation tickets purchased during the lapse period do not apply after December 31, 1996, and before the effective date of the amendments made by this section. The amendment to Section 9502(b) of the Code states that any tax amount received in the Treasury after specific dates shall be treated as received the day before such date, regardless of when it was actually received. This amendment applies to amounts received after December 31, 1995.
